posts.post_content:
Niv-Mizzet: 'Nothing shall stop me in my quest to seek the answer to the Maze! Nothing, you hear me?! NOTH-'  
  
*the next day...*  
  
'So Niv, still not reached that maze yet? Must've been something pretty powerful to stop you...'  
'Yes. Powerful. TERRIFYING. I don't want to talk about it. Shut up.'

posts.post_content:
What is powercreep? Well this is the perfect example of it. We have an environment where [Delver of Secrets](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Delver of Secrets) is barely being run and they make this monstrosity. I understand him being a sup'ed up [Grizzly Bears](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Grizzly Bears) But at least make him cost ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) the fact that he costs ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) is absurd. Then lets give him 4 abilities that basically hates Blue. Can't be countered might as well say **F.U. Blue**, Reach, Flash, and protection from Blue. Wow.   
  
I had this thing sprung on me and it was annoying. The fact that this thing blocks your 3/6 flier all day long and doesn't receive a scratch is ridiculous. Oh and for every green player who whines about Green not getting good creatures, look no more. This thing is hideous.
posts.html:

Posted By: GruesomeGoo (5/18/2013 8:14:47 AM)

posts.post_content:
People need to stop complaining on every card about power creep. The game's always going to have more and more powerful cards as it grows and as long as the cards aren't at the level of [Skullclamp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skullclamp) or [Jace, the Mind Sculptor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace, the Mind Sculptor) and as long as they don't wreck formats, there's nothing to complain about. This is a card that's sideboard material against blue. Sure it's good against blue but in most situations, it's just a bear with flash that can chump block fliers. It doesn't even stretch the P/T curve. It's still just a 2/2 at the end of the day.  
  
Why are people complaining more about Skylasher than [Voice of Resurgence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Voice of Resurgence) which has a massive impact on every game and is clearly not just a 2/2?
posts.html:
People need to stop complaining on every card about power creep. The game's always going to have more and more powerful cards as it grows and as long as the cards aren't at the level of Skullclamp or Jace, the Mind Sculptor and as long as they don't wreck formats, there's nothing to complain about. This is a card that's sideboard material against blue. Sure it's good against blue but in most situations, it's just a bear with flash that can chump block fliers. It doesn't even stretch the P/T curve. It's still just a 2/2 at the end of the day.

Why are people complaining more about Skylasher than Voice of Resurgence which has a massive impact on every game and is clearly not just a 2/2?

posts.post_content:
Usually I'm pleased when WotC releases extremely good green creatures. Green should have the very best creatures in the game I think. Although that has never really been the case.  
  
But this one breaks reasonable boundaries too much. Not as foolish as [Phyrexian Obliterator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Obliterator) or [Wurmcoil Engine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wurmcoil Engine) but still stupid.
